result.execSummary:
All charges against Mark Allen Remington in this case have been dismissed. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Mark Allen Remington is presumed innocent.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Mark Allen Remington

records.addlTxt: 11:28 AM Defendant Mark Allen Remington in court.  Attorney Jamy Richard Johansen in court for Mark Allen Remington.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews deferred agreement for 4 years in 21CF510 and to dismiss 22CF55. State has complied with Victim's Rights. Defendant pleads no contest to charge. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.  The Defendant understands all the rights he is waiving by his plea.  The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is deferred pursuant to the terms of the agreement. Court dismisses 22CF55.

11:12 AM Defendant Mark Allen Remington in court.  Attorney Jamy Richard Johansen in court for Mark Allen Remington.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls cases 21CF510 and 22CF55. State indicates that there is an agreement, asks for time to prepare DJOC. Asks for status in a week.
Status conference scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:25 AM Defendant Mark Allen Remington in court.  Attorney Jamy Richard Johansen in court for Mark Allen Remington.  Attorney Angela M Wilson in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Johansen asks for a status in mid to late August. State in agreement. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Status conference on June 6, 2022 at 11:00 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt: 10:39 AM Defendant Mark Allen Remington in court with attorney Jamy Richard Johansen.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. Attorney states their client wishes to waive their right to the preliminary hearing. Defendant agrees. Court accepts waiver of the Defendants right to a preliminary hearing as knowingly, understandingly, and voluntarily made. Court finds probable cause and binds the defendant over for arraignment. Court reminds the Defendant of bail conditions. Defendant provided notice.  Arraignment scheduled for April 18, 2022 at 11:00 am.
No use or possession of alcohol;   No use or possession of a firearm (including ammunition)

03:08 PM Defendant Mark Allen Remington in court with attorney Michael Charles Hoffman.  Defendant Mark Allen Remington in custody.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Mark Allen Remington appeared by video means with Attorney.
Court calls the case;     Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading. 
State request 500.00 cash bail and no use or possession of alcohol; another open case in Douglas County; conditions of no use or possession of alcohol; no firearms to include ammunition; nature of charges; out on bail; 
Atty Hoffman-lifelong resident of Douglas County; no failures to appear; defendant is not able to post
Court-concerned about felony failure to follow court orders; not hearing failures to appear; questions if there is any amount to post
Defendant-no money to post
Court-orders 2000.00 signature bond; conditions of no use or possession of alcohol and no ammunition  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 9, 2022 at 10:45 am.
